column5: Got out to Lake St Clair for the last boat trip of the year yesterday. Worth the drive. Fished the mouth and river at the "ditch" and ended up 4 for 8, Biggest was 50.5 and a 46 as well. The river was definetly more productive for us. All rips came on big nils custom painted, in blue perch and helin frog. Thanks to George/Wood Wacker for the awesome squirt job, I love it so much it gives me a "woodie"! lol heres some pics      the hot lure
great job moe. you did well.  being a dedicated guy you deserve them. that colors a good un.
That was a excellent day!!!!!,Too bad the end of your season!,always next year:good:.
Good stuff Moe. Not bad for that dirty water.
Thats a great day for sure!!
With fish like that Mr. Unis can squirt on my lures any time he wants
Looking at the satellite maps, the whole lake looked muddy, the only difference i figure is that fish in thames are used to feeding in muddy water
Nice report! Do musky's stay at the Thames all year or just in the fall? For some reason never thought they would be there but it makes sense. How far down the river can they be found?
Awesome trip moe. Them George painted nils are great. Congrats and thanks for sharing
Can't think of a better way to end a season than the day you guys had.   Congrats.
Awesome trip. Those are some nice fish as well.  Thanks for sharing.
some awesome fish guys !!! great way to end the season...cheers
Solid days effort beating up on the mucky trench muskies!  Nice fish.
